tls:text.tls:line: It is such a pity that before the upper garment (of Confucian 經) is completed people turn already to making the lower garments (of the various 邪說 of the non-Confucian 諸子)" 李軌：聖典，本也；諸子末也。

tls:text.tls:line: "The sages' ears will not put up with what is wrong,

sense.def: the person of extraordinary and creative talent (with untensed predicate)

tls:text.tls:line: As for the worthies their ears discriminate, and their mouths discriminate.

sense.def: abstractly: the man of talent and moral worth (at any time and in any place)

tls:text.tls:line: The ordinary are indiscriminate."

sense.def: intellectually ordinary people (who may be of considerable social status); the hoi polloi; a vulgar uneducated person (not necessarily plural!)

tls:text.tls:line: "And the worthies?"

sense.def: abstractly: the man of talent and moral worth (at any time and in any place)

tls:text.tls:line: observing the sages one gets an eye for worthies;

sense.def: the person of extraordinary and creative talent (with untensed predicate)

tls:text.tls:line: There are three kinds of passion in All under Heaven:
The ordinary people have a passion for following their own inclinations;
the worthy have a passion for setting themselves aright;
the worthy have a passion for setting themselves aright;
the worthy have a passion for setting themselves aright;
and the sages have a passion for taking themselves as their masters.
and the sages have a passion for taking themselves as their masters.

and if in the conduct of his outwardness he is serious and shows self-control

then he can bring serenity to this person of his."
